DataElement.preferredName: Electronic Cigarette Last 30 Day Temporal Frequency Use Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric response indicating the number of days that the patient used electronic cigarettes within the last 30 days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Electronic Cigarette Last 30 Day Temporal Frequency Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A battery-powered electronic device designed to atomize a nicotine-containing liquid solution for inhalation in a manner that simulates smoking a tobacco cigarette._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30_The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period._To put into action or service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A battery-powered electronic device designed to atomize a nicotine-containing liquid solution for inhalation in a manner that simulates smoking a tobacco cigarette.

Concepts.definition: A battery-powered electronic device designed to atomize a nicotine-containing liquid solution for inhalation in a manner that simulates smoking a tobacco cigarette.

Property.preferredName: Last Integer::30 Day Temporal Frequency Use
Property.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.:To put into action or service.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.
To put into action or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.
